lead_paragraph: A Human Rights Watch report on abuse by peacekeepers in Central African Republic added to what the United Nations has called a serious problem.

byline.contributor: Margaux Benn contributed reporting from Bangui, Central African Republic, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

headline.print_headline: Central Africa Peacekeepers Are Accused of Sex Crimes
headline.main: U.N. Peacekeepers Accused of Rape in Central African Republic

snippet: A Human Rights Watch report on abuse by peacekeepers in Central African Republic added to what the United Nations has called a serious problem.
abstract: Human Rights Watch report claims United Nations peacekeepers in Central African Republic raped or sexually exploited eight women and girls; United Nations mission in country says it has notified suspects' home countries and requested they launch  investigations; report comes weeks after independent panel chastised UN for its handling of sexual abuse cases involving peacekeepers.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: United Nations Department of Peacekeeping Operations
